title: alani123
author: alani123
content: This is THE thread to discuss anything related to Greece's Super League (1st league) and make predictions.   Greek Super League schedule: https://www.slgr.gr/en/schedule/Greek Super League scoreboard rankings: https://www.slgr.gr/en/scoreboard/Punters' favoritesInspired by @Trofo 's idea on the Premiere League thread, if you would like to have your message shown in the OP showcasing your support to your favorite team, just write @alani123 and I shall put you up here.  alani123 - OFI all the way. Support your local clubs!

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Nice to see that you started this thread after reading the hint of the proposed thread to discuss the Greek football league,  this will be an exciting thread just like the premiere leagues thread that serves as a motivation for this but then we look forward to seeing the thread gaining much attention. And in the weekend games,  congratulations to the Panathinaikos in their narrow victory against the Pas Lamia by leading with 1:2 goals in the match and also as the top in the league's table haven't accumulated 22 points in 9 matches. This season will indeed be an exciting one for the team,  but they also have to keep the trends,  otherwise, there could be a possible slide down,  just like as seen in the weekend game even though are leading the second goal did not come easy and that points to having prepared other clubs also are to taking over the position.

comments.author: Ultegra134
comments.body: I'll start by stating that I'm not a fan of football, the Super League, or sports betting in general. However, after a recent discussion with the OP on the local board, @alani123, there wasn't a thread regarding Greek football teams, except perhaps during nationals, where I remember seeing a few mentions, if I'm not mistaken. It's nice to see that the OP went ahead and created this thread; hopefully it may attract new people to the gambling section and is updated regularly with the new upcoming games.I'm hoping this thread gathers the attention the OP was hoping for, because I wasn't so optimistic about it.

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Quote from: Wiwo on November 04, 2023, 05:48:22 PMNice to see that you started this thread after reading the hint of the proposed thread to discuss the Greek football league,  this will be an exciting thread just like the premiere leagues thread that serves as a motivation for this but then we look forward to seeing the thread gaining much attention. And in the weekend games,  congratulations to the Panathinaikos in their narrow victory against the Pas Lamia by leading with 1:2 goals in the match and also as the top in the league's table haven't accumulated 22 points in 9 matches. This season will indeed be an exciting one for the team,  but they also have to keep the trends,  otherwise, there could be a possible slide down,  just like as seen in the weekend game even though are leading the second goal did not come easy and that points to having prepared other clubs also are to taking over the position. Indeed Panathinaikos is doing well this season but one has to wonder how long that's gonna last. They only won against Olympiakos via some legalese reasons after a hooligun of Olympiakos threw a flair on a player and the match was halted. Today However Olympiacos is so far losing against PAOK 3 to 0... It's crazy to see the #1 team of Greece for so many years perform this way. Truly it's a season of many upsets and the lesser known teams are putting in very good efforts. I think PAOK is bound to rise in the rankings though given how well they performed against Olympiakos.

comments.author: www.Gambler.Casino
comments.body: I hope that I will guess the results of many events. Good luck to all))

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Let me make a clear picture of how messed up is to find results here to make money out of the strong teams.I did bet on Panathinaikos to win at home against AEK and at that time Panathinaikos had 0 lost games they were dominating the league while AEK was a normal team in third or fourth place,yet Panathinaikos won first half and then in second half it ended 1-2 for AEK.I did bet on AEK on next week playing away against a weak team near bottom of the standings and I don't remember the name,all I know it was some odd just above 1.20 and the game ended draw.Now Olympiacos is losing 3-0 to PAOK,what more should I add to stop betting on this league or is money gone,at least this happened to me maybe because bad timing for the bets I made.

comments.author: famososMuertos
comments.body: .../77//:::Well, I bet on leagues that I know little or nothing about, basically in-play, and your story is something that happens, it is a fairly unpredictable league and I would say "unknown", but that is why I am excited about the thread, let's see if an expert arrives" local" that provides good information.In reality there are several Greek posters out there on the gambling frequency, anyway let's hope the OP gives love to the topic frequently.Tomorrow we have Panseraikos FC vs. OFI Crete, let's start with that one, so, what say the "experts" say @2.54 @3.10 @2.48

comments.author: ogamibr
comments.body: Quote from: alani123 on November 05, 2023, 07:08:24 PMQuote from: Wiwo on November 04, 2023, 05:48:22 PMNice to see that you started this thread after reading the hint of the proposed thread to discuss the Greek football league,  this will be an exciting thread just like the premiere leagues thread that serves as a motivation for this but then we look forward to seeing the thread gaining much attention. And in the weekend games,  congratulations to the Panathinaikos in their narrow victory against the Pas Lamia by leading with 1:2 goals in the match and also as the top in the league's table haven't accumulated 22 points in 9 matches. This season will indeed be an exciting one for the team,  but they also have to keep the trends,  otherwise, there could be a possible slide down,  just like as seen in the weekend game even though are leading the second goal did not come easy and that points to having prepared other clubs also are to taking over the position. Indeed Panathinaikos is doing well this season but one has to wonder how long that's gonna last. They only won against Olympiakos via some legalese reasons after a hooligun of Olympiakos threw a flair on a player and the match was halted. Today However Olympiacos is so far losing against PAOK 3 to 0... It's crazy to see the #1 team of Greece for so many years perform this way. Truly it's a season of many upsets and the lesser known teams are putting in very good efforts. I think PAOK is bound to rise in the rankings though given how well they performed against Olympiakos. I was reading about Panathinaikos and doing some research, I dont know much about Greek soccer  .In 2023, they have slowed considerably, but they are still in the running for gold. The "clover" was in second place in the competition after 29 rounds, having lost to the first-place AEK in additional indications, while the third-place Olympiacos led by three points. Volos and "double-headed eagles" were the opponents in the first two "dry" world matches played by Ivan Jovanovich's side in the Champions group. The capital club then traveled to Thessaloniki, where it proved to be more formidable than Aris due to Andraj Sporar's lone precise shot in the 69th minute of play.Dimitris Kourbelis and his associates don't seem as assured as they were in 2022. It will undoubtedly be impossible for the Athens to defeat the "union" if they keep losing points. In order for the Clover to win the 21st championship title in team history, it is crucial that they pick up steam once more.Fun fact for me, they are known as "Greens"

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Quote from: famososMuertos on November 05, 2023, 09:21:54 PM.../77//:::Well, I bet on leagues that I know little or nothing about, basically in-play, and your story is something that happens, it is a fairly unpredictable league and I would say "unknown", but that is why I am excited about the thread, let's see if an expert arrives" local" that provides good information.In reality there are several Greek posters out there on the gambling frequency, anyway let's hope the OP gives love to the topic frequently.Tomorrow we have Panseraikos FC vs. OFI Crete, let's start with that one, so, what say the "experts" say @2.54 @3.10 @2.48These are some of the most unpredictable teams in the league IMO. Just running from memory I remember OFI sporadically having huge outbursts of great performance, but overall we're just happy for the team to stay in the 1st league without delegation. Panseraikos has had a more adventurous history, being all the way down to league 4 in 2020 but have since reached successive promotions all the way to the first league for this season. Also it's obvious that OFI is having a strong season by the fact that they have won against PAOK, Aris, and AEK which are generally regarded as some of the best and most historical clubs in Greece. Only worrying result OFI had so far was losing to Asteras Tripolis 3 - 0, and Asteras isn't considered one of the best teams. But surely OFI is having a much better year than Panseraikos who will need to improve a lot if they want to remain out of relegation play outs with more certainty. So at these odds I think it's a no brainer to bet for OFI.

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Alright, on to a new match day! Starting tomorrow we'll see some interesting matches. This match day there's no Derby of the eternal enemies as it's called in Greece but we actually have some strong teams against ones lower in the standings.PAOK, AEK and Aris probably are in for easy wins. To me it's a miracle Volos is even int he 1st division.  The stars really had to align for this to happen given that they aren't really that strong of a team.So I like the odds betting on Aris to win here. Another bet I like is over 1.75 on OFI vs. Pas GianninaBoth teams have been investing a lot in offense but OFI especially judging from the last match even with my prediction above (lol) doesn't do well in defense lately! But also OFI had scored some wins against bigger teams earlier on so a score above 2 goals seems likely.

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Aris had a strong day today finishing 2 - 0 against Volos, as of OFI vs PAS Giannina, the game went 1 - 1 so we won half the profit from the above odds with a 1.75 over bet. 1.5 right predictions from yesterday!  For tomorrow I'm setting my eyes on PAOK and AEK hoping for their win in each team's match. The odds don't give a high return in these bets as a win for the bigger teams seems kinda predictable but hey, it's ok to go with some of the more secure bets from time to time. For those that would like some more rewarding odds:The match of Olympiacos going against Asteras Tripolis seems to be more rewarding. Of course I would be going for an Olympiacos win. But the odds seem favorable especially given that Olympiacos is narowly second in the league and generally considered the strongest team in the country. It's probably not the team's best season but they could surely win against Asteras Tripolis...

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Seems like we got 3/3 yesterday!   That's a good day if I ever saw one! Seems like this year's super league teams are investing a lot in offense and it's paying out for the bigger teams. The match between PAOK and Panetolikos surely was the most interesting as both teams scored. With Panetolikos even having scored first!For being a lesser known team Panetolikos surely put out a good match and it sure as hell was an interesting match with the smaller team scoring first only to lose later. With all goals being in the first half too! But in the end the expected result came so if anyone took the bet they would have won. I'd love to see if anyone caught that.   I hope you're enjoying the profits

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Here I am posting about the new and upcoming matchday.  To be honest I don't see anything very interesting in these matches. I expect at least some interesting play in the Aris - Panathinaikos match as it's probably the biggest match up in this particular match day. But the rest of the matches are not between two big teams. So perhaps most people would consider them predictable, unless an upset is to take place. I'm eager to see if anyone has some predictions to make. For now I'll only say that I'm rooting for my local team, OFI. OFI had some good wins this season against bigger clubs and is higher in the standings but hasn't been performing that well lately. The odds aren't bad though, I'd take this bet. Any other predictions before me?

comments.author: alani123
comments.created_time: November 26, 2023, 02:42:30 PMLast edit: December 02, 2023, 05:01:34 AM by alani123
comments.body: Another disappointing result by my team OFI this season  I am worried I will have to worry about relegation later, so I will probably stop betting with them for now. Already disappointing enough to see them not win, no need to lose money on it also. 🤣So let's see the matches for this match day that remain. I really believe Panathinaikos is favored to win today. Yes they lost some matches recently but I don't think this is representative of the Greek league as Aris overall this season isn't close to competing. The odds are very good so I think this is a good bet to go in hoping for a win. Good luck to all!!🤞

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: I did take those odds in a parlay and so far Aris is winning 1-0 with just about half an hour to play,based on how the Greek Super League is I doubt Panathinaikos will be able to respond back.This game brought me back sad memories when I had bet a lot of money on Panathinaikos playing at home against AEK and they were leading 1-0 and then got to lose the game,strange happening although that game is a derby and any result is acceptable.Nevertheless I must say that most of the games from this league come as expected especially when big guys are playing against weak or average teams,so even if I lose that bet I am not caring that much.

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Welp, that's the magic of it, results can be unpredictable at times! Here we are with a new matchday now though: My predictions are on wins for:PAOKOlympiacosPanathinaikos Because sometimes you have to go with the more secure ones. Odds aren't the best and I'm still contemplating if I should make this a multi, But I think it's hard to go wrong when the matchups are so uneven. Good luck!

comments.author: Ultegra134
comments.body: Quote from: alani123 on December 02, 2023, 05:00:55 AMWelp, that's the magic of it, results can be unpredictable at times! Here we are with a new matchday now though: ~Snipped~My predictions are on wins for:PAOKOlympiacosPanathinaikos Because sometimes you have to go with the more secure ones. Odds aren't the best and I'm still contemplating if I should make this a multi, ~Snipped~But I think it's hard to go wrong when the matchups are so uneven. Good luck! Good call; it's tempting to make a bet myself too; all three matchups you pointed out are pretty uneven, and there's a decent chance you'll win. Olympiakos against Volos? It seems like a walk in the park, to be honest. PAOK, in opposition to Lamia, also seems like a sure win. Panathinaikos against OFI isn't as uneven as the other two, but still, the scales are tipping towards Panathinaikos for sure, even though, judging by your previous posts, you support OFI. If I were you, I'd also bet AEK against Aris; it seems like a probable win as well. Did you check their odds? Anyway, I wish you good luck!

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Quote from: Ultegra134 on December 02, 2023, 07:27:15 AMGood call; it's tempting to make a bet myself too; all three matchups you pointed out are pretty uneven, and there's a decent chance you'll win. Olympiakos against Volos? It seems like a walk in the park, to be honest. PAOK, in opposition to Lamia, also seems like a sure win. Panathinaikos against OFI isn't as uneven as the other two, but still, the scales are tipping towards Panathinaikos for sure, even though, judging by your previous posts, you support OFI. If I were you, I'd also bet AEK against Aris; it seems like a probable win as well. Did you check their odds? Anyway, I wish you good luck!OFI as I've posted above has disappointed me. I mean yes, it's my team but when it comes to money you've gotta win sometimes  So judging by past performance, I'm really betting against my team now. As of Aris' matchup with AEK... Well it's a tough one. AEK is performing very well on the local league, but did not do so well in Europa League. That's pretty much also true for all Greek teams in Europa League also but the difference here is that Aris won their previous match against Panathinaikos, who currently ranks first! While that was surely an upset, Aris surely proved that they have some good underdog strength this season. They'd have their chances for a win against AEK maybe so it's not that certain of a bet when betting for a win for me.

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: Damn, Olympiacos being in a tie even with a red card against Volos is a very upsetting result. Surely very far from whatever anyone would have foreseen. I was expecting a boring match with just a goal or two scored by Olympiacos but the end result was very different:Olympiacos even got 3 yellow cards... And managed to only end up in a tie even with Volos missing a penalty. Probably the game ended up in a tie just because Volos scored an own goal!? Olympiacos didn't even score for the entire match after 54'. To be fair though a goal of Olympiacos was canceled after a VAR. I wonder how different platforms would treat a canceled goal. Whoever took the bet they can let us know.

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: It's very likely that the next match day in the Greek super league is not going to take place as scheduled.Referees decided to strike and formally announced their decision, forwarded in a letter to UEFA. They're citing threats received by Mr. Papapetrou, a local referee who was overseeing the adventurous match between Olympiacos and Volos. Now also Olympiacos owner has come out saying that football in Greece is controlled by a criminal gang.
